intro: Eriosema shirense, commonly known as the velvetleaf eriosema, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Eriosema shirense is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects.
